Work With Us At Gaspar’s Grotto, we practice diversity. Our bar staff, servers and kitchen crew are all over the map in that regard. However they all have one thing in common, they are friendly, service oriented individuals with winning personalities who care deeply about their guests and their own ability to provide world class service and provide a comfortable and memorable atmosphere for the guests. Entertainment Gaspar’s Grotto is always interested in employing new musical talent and eclectic entertainers. We are actively seeking to employ magicians, stilt walkers, contortionists, mimes, fire eaters, knife throwers, organ grinders, animal acts et al. If it’s not often seen, unusual, offbeat, strange or even bizarre, it’s a fit. Gaspar’s is a fun and safe place for these performers to practice their art. Send an email to adam@gasparsgrotto.com for more information about live entertainment bookings. Bar Staff & Servers Every bartender at Gaspar’s has over 150 drink recipes committed to memory. All are actively seeking to upgrade their knowledge. Many practice the art of flair and all use their creativity to dress like the pirates they are. These are conditions of employment at Gaspar’s Grotto. Please stop by and fill out an application in person for bar staff and serving positions. Kitchen Crew The kitchen at Gaspar’s Grotto is a tightly run ship under Executive Chef Itza Henderson. It is a fast-paced and high volume environment. If you apply, be prepared to work. Stop by and ask to speak to Cap’n Hook if you are interested in being a part of the kitchen crew! Running of the Ship There are several other employment opportunities at Gaspar’s Grotto including, cleaning, security, barback, and porter positions. Please stop by and fill out an application in person. GASPAR’S GROTTO 1805 E 7th Ave Tampa, FL 33605 (813) 248-5900 Click here to find out why we're among Tampa's top restaurants. You must check the box to subscribe Home Destinations USA Europe Africa & The Middle East Asia Australia & The Pacific Canada Caribbean Mexico & Central America South America View All Destinations Hotels Travel News Cruises Cruise Overview Cruise News Cruising 101 Cruise Directory Forums Africa & the Middle East Asia Australia & the Pacific Canada Caribbean Europe Mexico & Central America South America United States Air Travel Cruises Travel Tips & Trip Ideas Forums Help View All Forums Trip Ideas National Parks Best Road Trips in America Ultimate Guides Login Subscribe The Tampa Bay Area Overview Hotels Restaurants Sights Top Places Shopping Nightlife Performing Arts Gallery More The Tampa Bay Area Things to Do The Tampa Bay Area Travel Guide Overview Hotels Restaurants See Top Places Shopping Nightlife Arts Gallery Sights Shopping Nightlife Performing Arts Fodor's Expert Review Gaspar's Grotto The Tampa Bay Area Bars Notorious Spanish pirate José Gaspar was known for swashbuckling up and down Florida's west coast in the late 18th and early 19th century. His legend has inspired a massive, raucous street festival each winter. This Ybor City drinkery has adopted his name, and rightly so. Decked out in tons of pirate memorabilia, it's the cornerstone to any night spent barhopping on the Ybor strip. The sangria is a good choice, but the aged rums might be even better. You'll also find a food menu that goes well beyond standard bar fare. Bars Quick Facts 1805 E. 7th Ave. Tampa, Florida 33605, USA 813-248–5900 gasparsgrotto.com What’s Nearby Related Forum Posts Moving to Florida from Oregon by bivette on
